schema.description:
The ID of the region in which you want to store the backup data. You can query the supported regions of Database Backup (DBS) by calling the [DescribeRegions](~~437238~~) operation.

>  For more information, see [Endpoints](~~437201~~).

The type of the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **micro**
*   **small**
*   **medium**
*   **large**
*   **xlarge**

>  A backup schedule type with higher specifications offers higher backup and restoration performance. For more information, see [Select a backup schedule type](~~84372~~).

The type of the source database. Valid values:

*   **MySQL**
*   **MSSQL**
*   **Oracle**
*   **MariaDB**
*   **PostgreSQL**
*   **DRDS**
*   **MongoDB**
*   **Redis**

The backup method of the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **logical**: logical backup
*   **physical**: physical backup
*   **duplication**: dump backup

The unit of the subscription period. Valid values:

*   **Year**: yearly subscription
*   **Month**: monthly subscription

The subscription period. Valid values:

*   If **Period** is set to **Year**, the valid values of **UsedTime** range from 1 to 5.
*   If **Period** is set to **Month**, the valid values of **UsedTime** range from 1 to 11.

The billing method of the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **postpay**: pay-as-you-go
*   **prepay**: subscription

> The default value is **prepay**. If the **BackupMethod** parameter is set to **duplication**, **postpay** is supported.

The region in which the database you want to back up resides.

> This parameter is required if the **PayType** parameter is set to **postpay**.

The region in which you want to store the backup data.

> This parameter is required if the **PayType** parameter is set to **postpay**.

The type of the source database instance. Valid values:

*   **RDS**: ApsaraDB RDS.
*   **PolarDB**: PolarDB.
*   **DDS**: ApsaraDB for MongoDB.
*   **Kvstore**: ApsaraDB for Redis.
*   **Other**: Database connected by using an IP address and a port number.
*   **dg**: Self-managed database that has no public IP address or port number and is connected over Database Gateway.

>  If **PayType** is set to **postpay**, this parameter is required.
This parameter is unavailable.
The source of the request. The default value is OpenAPI and cannot be changed.
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.
The ID of the resource group.
The response parameters.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request is successful. Valid values:

*   **true**: The request is successful.
*   **false**: The request fails.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

BackupPlanId.description: The ID of the backup schedule.

CreateBackupPlan.description: For more information about how to create a backup schedule in the Database Backup (DBS) console, see [Purchase a backup schedule](~~65909~~).

CreateAndStartBackupPlan.summary: Creates, configures, and starts a backup schedule.

schema.description: The ID of the backup schedule.
The ID of the region in which you want to store the backup data. You can query the supported regions of DBS by calling the [DescribeRegions](~~437238~~) operation.

The type of the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **micro**
*   **small**
*   **medium**
*   **large**
*   **xlarge**

>  A backup schedule type with higher specifications offers higher backup and restoration performance. For more information, see [Select a backup schedule type](~~84372~~).

The type of the source database. Valid values:

*   **MySQL**
*   **MSSQL**
*   **Oracle**
*   **MariaDB**
*   **PostgreSQL**
*   **DRDS**
*   **MongoDB**
*   **Redis**

The method that is used to generate the backup file. Valid values:

*   **logical**: logical backup
*   **physical**: physical backup
*   **duplication**: dump backup

Specifies whether to use yearly subscription or monthly subscription for the instance. Valid values:

*   **Year**: yearly subscription
*   **Month**: monthly subscription

The subscription duration.

*   If **Period** is set to **Year**, the valid values of **UsedTime** range from 1 to 5.
*   If **Period** is set to **Month**, the valid values of **UsedTime** range from 1 to 11.

The billing method. Valid values:

*   **postpay**: pay-as-you-go.
*   **prepay**: subscription.

>  The default value is **prepay**. You can set this parameter to **postpay** only if you set **BackupMethod** to **duplication**.

The region in which the database that you want to back up resides.

> This parameter is required if the **PayType** parameter is set to **postpay**.

The region in which you want to store the backup data.

> This parameter is required if the **PayType** parameter is set to **postpay**.

The type of the source database instance. Valid values:

*   **RDS**: ApsaraDB RDS.
*   **PolarDB**: PolarDB.
*   **DDS**: ApsaraDB for MongoDB.
*   **Kvstore**: ApsaraDB for Redis.
*   **Other**: Database connected by using an IP address and a port number.
*   **dg**: Self-managed database that has no public IP address or port number and is connected over Database Gateway.

>  If **PayType** is set to **postpay**, this parameter is required.
This parameter is unavailable.
The request source. Default value: OpenApi. You do not need to set this parameter.

The location of the source database. Valid values:

*   **RDS**: The database is on an ApsaraDB RDS instance.
*   **ECS**: The database is on an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.
*   **Express**: The database is connected to DBS by using Express Connect, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway.
*   **Agent**: The database is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway.
*   **DDS**: The database is on an ApsaraDB for MongoDB instance.
*   **Other**: The database is connected to DBS by using an IP address and a port number.
*   **dg**: The database is a self-managed database that has no public IP address or port number and is connected to DBS over Database Gateway.

The region in which the database that you want to back up resides.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **RDS**, **ECS**, **DDS**, **Express**, or **Agent**.

The ID of the database instance.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **RDS**, **ECS**, **DDS**, or **Express**.

The endpoint of the database.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **Express**, **Agent**, or **Other**.

The port of the database.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **Express**, **Agent**, **Other**, or **ECS**.

The name of the database.

> This parameter is required if the DatabaseType parameter is set to **PostgreSQL** or **MongoDB**.

The username of the account that is used to connect to the database.

> This parameter is required except that the database is an SQL Server database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a Redis database.

The password of the account that is used to connect to the database.

> This parameter is required except that the database is an SQL Server database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a Redis database.

The backup gateway ID.

> 

*   If **SourceEndpointInstanceType** is set to **Agent**, this parameter is required.****

*   For more information about how to install a backup gateway, see [Install a backup gateway](~~93250~~).

*   You can query a list of existing backup gateways by calling the [DescribeBackupGatewayList](~~437230~~) operation.
The name of the Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket used to store backup files. By default, the system automatically generates a name for the OSS bucket.
The object to be backed up.
schema.example: \[ { "DBName":"Name of the database to be backed up", "SchemaName":"Name of the schema to be backed up", "TableIncludes":\[{ "TableName":"Name of the table to be backed up" }], "TableExcludes":\[{ "TableName":"Name of the table that you do not want to back up" }] } ]

schema.description:
The day of the week on which you want to perform full backup. Valid values:

*   **Monday**
*   **Tuesday**
*   **Wednesday**
*   **Thursday**
*   **Friday**
*   **Saturday**
*   **Sunday**

>  You can specify multiple values. Separate multiple values with commas (,).
The start time of full backup tasks. Specify the value in the *HH:mm* format. The time must be in UTC.

Specifies whether to enable the incremental log backup feature. Valid values:

*   **true**: enables the incremental log backup feature.
*   **false**: disables the incremental log backup feature.

The interval at which you want to perform incremental log backups. Unit: seconds.

>  This parameter is required only if you set BackupMethod to **physical**.
The number of days for which the backup data is retained. Valid values: 0 to 1825. Default value: 730.
The number of days after which the storage class of the backup data is changed to Infrequent Access (IA). Default value: 180.
The number of days after which the storage class of the backup data is changed to Archive. Default value: 365.
The name of the backup schedule.
The system ID (SID) of the Oracle database. This parameter is required if the source database is an Oracle database.

The storage type. Valid values:

*   Empty: If you do not specify this parameter, the system stores backup data in your OSS bucket.
*   system : The system stores backup data in the built-in OSS bucket of DBS.

The I/O limit for the disk. Unit: KB/s.

>  This parameter takes effect only when physical backups for MySQL databases are performed.

The network bandwidth throttling. Unit: KB/s. DBS allows a maximum bandwidth of 10 GB/s.

>  This parameter takes effect only when physical backups for MySQL databases are performed.

The backup method that you want to use for full backups. Valid values:

*   **simple**: scheduled backup. If you specify this value for the BackupStrategyType parameter, you must also specify the BackupPeriod and BackupStartTime parameters.
*   **Manual**: manual backup.

> Default value: **simple**.
The unique ID (UID) of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the source database belongs.
The name of the RAM role that is used to perform backups across Alibaba Cloud accounts.
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.
The ID of the resource group.
The response parameters.

CreateBackupSet.description:
Indicates whether a backup is performed immediately after the backup schedule is configured. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Success.description: Indicates whether the request is successful.

EnableBackupLog.title: EnableBackupLog
EnableBackupLog.description:
## Impact

It is free to enable the incremental log backup feature. However, the backup traffic and storage capacity generated by the feature are billed in the same way as the full backup feature, and can be offset by the free quota of backup schedules or storage plans.

ModifyBackupSourceEndpoint.summary: Modifies the information of a backup source.

schema.description: The ID of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup schedule.

The location of the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the location. Valid values:

*   **RDS**
*   **ECS**
*   **Express**: The database is connected to DBS by using Express Connect, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway.
*   **Agent**: The database is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway.
*   **DDS**: The database is an ApsaraDB for MongoDB database.
*   **Other**: The database is connected to DBS by using the IP address and port of the database.

The region in which the database you want to back up resides. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the region.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, Express, or Agent.

The ID of the database instance. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the instance ID of the database.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, or Express.

The endpoint of the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the endpoint of the database.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to Express, Agent, or Other.

The port that is used to connect to the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the port.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to Express, Agent, Other, or ECS.

The name of the database.

*   This parameter is required if the database is a PostgreSQL or MongoDB database.
*   This parameter is required if the database is an SQL Server database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway.

The account that is used to log on to the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to the account.

This parameter is required except that the database is an SQL Server database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a Redis database.

The password of the account that is used to connect to the database.

This parameter is required except that the database is an SQL Server database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a Redis database.

The ID of the backup gateway. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup gateway.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to Agent.

The objects to be backed up. This parameter is required except that the database is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the objects to be backed up.

ModifyStorageStrategy.summary: Modifies the lifecycle of data that is backed up based on a backup schedule.

schema.description: The ID of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup schedule.

The number of days for which the backup data is retained. Valid values: 0 to 1825.

> Default value: 730.

The number of days after which the storage class of the backup data is changed to Infrequent Access (IA). The value of this parameter must be smaller than the value of the DuplicationArchivePeriod parameter. For more information about the IA storage class, see [Storage class overview](~~51374~~).

> Default value: 180.

The number of days after which the storage class of the backup data is changed to Archive. The value of this parameter must be smaller than the value of the BackupRetentionPeriod parameter. For more information about the Archive storage class, see [Storage class overview](~~51374~~).

> Default value: 365.

DescribeRestoreRangeInfo.summary: Queries the details of time ranges to which you can restore data in a specified backup schedule.

schema.description: The ID of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup schedule.

The beginning of the time range to which you can restore data. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the value of the BeginTimestampForRestore parameter for each backup schedule.

The end of the time range to which you can restore data. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the value of the EndTimestampForRestore parameter for each backup schedule.
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.
Specifies whether to query the most recent point in time to which you can restore data.
The response parameters.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request is successful. Valid values:

*   **true**: The request is successful.
*   **false**: The request fails.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

DBSRecoverRange.description: The information about the time ranges to which you can restore data.

items.description: The information about the time range to which you can restore data.

EndTimestampForRestore.description: The end of the time range to which you can restore data.

RangeType.description:
The type of the time range to which you can restore data.

*   **point**: The time range contains discrete points in time at which full backups were performed.
*   **range**: The time range is a period of time for which continuous backup is performed. You can specify a random point in time in the time range to restore data.

BeginTimestampForRestore.description: The beginning of the time range to which you can restore data.

SourceEndpointInstanceID.description: The ID of the database instance.

FullBackupDetail.description: If the value of the RangeType parameter is point, this parameter is returned. The value of this parameter describes information about all backup points in the time range.

items.description: The details of the backup point.

EndTime.description: The end time of the full backup task. Example: 1646760308000.

StartTime.description: The start time of the full backup task. Example: 1646760282000.

BackupSetId.description: The ID of the backup set.

DescribeBackupPlanBilling.summary: Queries the billing information of a backup schedule.

schema.description: The ID of the backup gateway.

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that it is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.
Indicates whether the storage type is displayed.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request is successful.

ErrMessage.example: This backupPlan can't support this action

Item.description: The billing information of the backup schedule.

BuyCreateTimestamp.description: The timestamp that indicates when the instance was purchased.

FullStorageSize.description: The size of the built-in storage for storing full backup data.

BuyExpiredTimestamp.description:
The timestamp that indicates when the instance expires.

> This parameter is available only if the value of the BuyChargeType parameter is PREPAY.

QuotaEndTimestamp.description: The timestamp that indicates when the billing cycle of free backup traffic ends.

IsExpired.description:
Indicates whether the instance expired.

> This parameter is available only if the value of the BuyChargeType parameter is PREPAY.

QuotaStartTimestamp.description: The timestamp that indicates when the billing cycle of free backup traffic starts.

TotalFreeBytes.description:
The total free backup traffic in the current month.

> This parameter is available only if the value of the BuyChargeType parameter is PREPAY and the value of the IsFreeBytesUnlimited parameter is false.

PaiedBytes.description: The total paid backup traffic in the current month.

UsedFullBytes.description: The paid full backup traffic in the current month.

IsFreeBytesUnlimited.description: Indicates whether the instance has no backup traffic limit.

ContStorageSize.description: The size of the built-in storage for storing incremental backup data.

BuyChargeType.description:
The billing method. Valid values:

*   PREPAY
*   POSTPAY

UsedIncrementBytes.description: The paid incremental backup traffic in the current month.

schema.description: The ID of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup schedule.

The location of the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the location. Valid values:

*   **RDS**
*   **ECS**
*   **Express**: The database is connected to DBS by using Express Connect, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway.
*   **Agent**: The database is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway.
*   **DDS**: The database is an ApsaraDB for MongoDB database.
*   **Other**: The database is connected to DBS by using the IP address and port of the database.

The region in which the database you want to back up resides. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the region.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, Express, or Agent.

The ID of the database instance. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the database instance.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **RDS**, **ECS**, **DDS**, or **Express**.

The endpoint that is used to connect to the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the endpoint.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **Express**, **Agent**, or **Other**.

The port that is used to connect to the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the port.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **Express**, **Agent**, **Other**, or **ECS**.

The name of the database. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the name of the database.

> This parameter is required if the database is a **PostgreSQL** or **MongoDB** database.

The username of the account that is used to connect to the database.

> This parameter is required except that the database is an **SQL Server** database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a **Redis** database.

The password of the account that is used to connect to the database.

> This parameter is required except that the database is an **SQL Server** database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a **Redis** database.

The ID of the backup gateway. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup gateway.

> This parameter is required if the **SourceEndpointInstanceType** parameter is set to **Agent**.
The name of the Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket that is used to store backup files. By default, the system automatically generates a name for the OSS bucket.
The objects to be backed up. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the objects.
schema.example: \[ { "DBName":"Name of the database to be backed up", "SchemaName":"Name of the schema to be backed up", "TableIncludes":\[{ "TableName":"Name of the table to be backed up" }], "TableExcludes":\[{ "TableName":"Name of the table to be excluded during the backup" }] } ]

schema.description:
The day of each week when the full backup task runs. Valid values:

*   **Monday**
*   **Tuesday**
*   **Wednesday**
*   **Thursday**
*   **Friday**
*   **Saturday**
*   **Sunday**

The start time of full backup tasks. Specify the value in the *HH:mmZ* format. The time must be in UTC. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the start time of full backup tasks.

Specifies whether to enable the incremental log backup feature. Valid values:

*   **true**: enables the incremental log backup feature.
*   **false**: disables the incremental log backup feature.

The interval at which you want to perform incremental log backups. Unit: seconds.

> This parameter takes effect only when physical backups are performed.
The number of days for which the backup data is retained. Valid values: 0 to 1825. Default value: 730.
The number of days after which the storage class of the backup data is changed to Infrequent Access (IA). Default value: 180.
The number of days after which the storage class of the backup data is changed to Archive. Default value: 365.
The name of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the name of the backup schedule.

The system ID (SID) of the Oracle database.

> This parameter is required if the database is an Oracle database.

The storage type. Valid values:

*   Empty: If you do not specify this parameter, the system stores backup data in your OSS bucket.
*   system: The system stores backup data in the built-in OSS bucket of DBS.

The I/O limit for the disk. Unit: KB/s.

> This parameter takes effect only when physical backups for MySQL databases are performed.

The network bandwidth throttling. Unit: KB/s. DBS allows a maximum bandwidth of 10 GB/s.

> This parameter takes effect only when physical backups for MySQL databases are performed.

The backup method that you want to use for full backups. Valid values:

*   **simple**: scheduled backup. If you specify this value for the BackupStrategyType parameter, you must also specify the BackupPeriod and BackupStartTime parameters.
*   **Manual**: manual backup.

> Default value: **simple**.
The unique ID (UID) of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the backup schedule belongs. You can call the [DescribeRestoreTaskList](~~437228~~) operation to obtain the UID of the Alibaba Cloud account.
The name of the RAM role that is used to perform backups across Alibaba Cloud accounts. You can call the [DescribeRestoreTaskList](~~437228~~) operation to obtain the RAM role.

Specifies whether to enable the automatic backup feature.

*   **true**: enables the automatic backup feature.
*   **false**: disables the automatic backup feature.
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.
ResourceGroupId.
The response parameters.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request is successful. Valid values:

*   **true**: The request is successful.
*   **false**: The request fails.

## Impacts

After a pay-as-you-go backup schedule is released, it stops providing services. Database Backup (DBS) no longer charges you fees for this backup schedule.

schema.description: The ID of the backup schedule.

The location of the database. Valid values:

*   **RDS**: The database is deployed on an ApsaraDB RDS instance.
*   **ECS**: The database is deployed on an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.
*   **Express**: The database is connected to Database Backup (DBS) by using Express Connect, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway.
*   **Agent**: The database is connected over a DBS backup gateway.
*   **DDS**: The database is an ApsaraDB for MongoDB database.
*   **Other**: The database is connected to DBS by using the IP address and port of the database.
*   **dg**: The database is a self-managed database that does not have public IP addresses or port numbers and is connected to DBS over Database Gateway.

The region ID of the destination database instance.

>  You must specify this parameter if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, Express, or Agent.

The ID of the database instance.

> This parameter is required if the DestinationEndpointInstanceType parameter is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, or Express.

The endpoint that is used to connect to the database.

> This parameter is required if the DestinationEndpointInstanceType parameter is set to Express, Agent, or Other.

The port of the database.
> This parameter is required if the DestinationEndpointInstanceType parameter is set to Express, Agent, Other, or ECS.

The name of the database.



> This parameter is required if the database is a PostgreSQL database or a MongoDB database.

The username of the account that is used to connect to the database.


> This parameter is required except that the database is an SQL Server database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a Redis database.

The password of the account that is used to connect to the source database.



> This parameter is required except that the database is an SQL Server database that is connected to DBS over a DBS backup gateway or a Redis database.

The ID of the backup gateway.

> This parameter is required if the DestinationEndpointInstanceType parameter is set to Agent.

The objects to be restored.



> This parameter is required except that the DestinationEndpointInstanceType parameter is set to Agent. For information about the parameter definition, see RestoreObjects.
schema.example: [ { "DBName":"Name of the database to be restored", "NewDBName":"Name of the database to which the objects will be restored", "SchemaName":"Schema name of the database to be restored", "NewSchemaName":"Schema name of the destination database to which the objects will be restored"}]

The program directory of the database.

CreateGetDBListFromAgentTask.summary: Creates a task to obtain a database list by using a backup gateway.

schema.description:
The ID of the backup gateway. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to query the ID.

>  This parameter is required.

The type of the database. Valid values:

*   **MySQL**
*   **MSSQL**
*   **Oracle**
*   **MariaDB**
*   **PostgreSQL**
*   **DRDS**
*   **MongoDB**
*   **Redis**
The region in which the backup gateway resides.
The URL that is used to access the database.
The port that is used to connect to the database.

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that it is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

ErrMessage.example: This backupPlan can't support this action

TaskId.description: The ID of the asynchronous task.

DescribePreCheckProgressList.summary: Queries the precheck progress of a backup schedule or a restore task.

schema.description:
The backup schedule ID.

>  You must specify one of BackupPlanId and RestoreTaskId.
The restoration task ID.
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.
Schema of Response

Status.description:
The status of the precheck. Valid values:

*   **running**: The precheck is in progress.
*   **failed**: The precheck failed.
*   **finish**: The precheck is complete.

Progress.description: The precheck progress. Valid values: 0 to 100.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

FinishTime.description: The time when the check for the item was complete. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

State.description:
The state of the check for the item. Valid values:

*   **init**: The check for the item is being initialized.
*   **warning**: A warning is reported.
*   **catched**: An exception occurs.
*   **running**: The check for the item is in progress.
*   **failed**: The check for the item fails.
*   **finish**: The check for the item is completed.

BootTime.description: The time when the check for the item started. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

JobId.description: The ID of the job for the check item.

Item.description: The name of the check item.

ErrMsg.example: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find any schema ......

OrderNum.description: The sequence number of the check item.

Names.description: The name of the group to which the check item belongs.

DescribeDLAService.summary: Queries the status of the Data Lake Analytics (DLA) service for a backup schedule.

schema.description: The ID of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup schedule.
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request is successful.

State.description:
The status of the DLA service for the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **Running**: DLA is running.
*   **Closing**: DLA is being disabled.
*   **Closed**: DLA is disabled.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

AutoAdd.description:
Specifies whether to enable the feature of automatically adding incremental data to a data lake. If this feature is enabled, DBS adds the backup sets that are newly generated to the data lake that is created for the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **true**: enables the feature.
*   **false**: disables the feature.

HaveJobFailed.description:
Indicates whether a failed DLA task exists in the return result. Valid values:

*   **true**: A failed DLA task exists.
*   **false**: No failed DLA task exists.
